message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is about a corpus of text data collected from the news domain, which is used for classification tasks such as binary discrimination of Moldavian versus Romanian text samples and multi-class categorization by topic. The paper also presents experiments using both shallow and deep approaches for classification. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and named entity recognition (cs.NE), which are also relevant sub-categories.
